title: Is it sexist to suggest that a male that teachers think is ADHD, is really just an ordinary male? - Quora

response.answer_text: No it is not. I cannot get my head around this ADHD craze which is sexist. Data and Statistics About ADHD | CDC Now if the genders were switched with girls being diagnosed at double the rate of boys Feminists would simply loose their minds! Boys can be boisterous in a group. That is called being male. I was boisterous prone to fights and revelled in mischief and I grew up to be an accountant.

When I was doing playground duty with first grade boys in a public school, I was horrified at the pushing, jumping, running and total chaos these kids produced. I don’t know how anyone could tell who was ADHD or not. They are constantly wild!
